intro: Canthium barbatum f. pitcairnense, commonly known as the Pitcairn nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the island of Pitcairn in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
